description:
Features Include:


The Horror Of The Doll-Devil
Horatius At the Bridge
The Coils of the Python
name: The Horror Of The Doll-Devil

description:
Features Include:


River of Fire
The Mad Countess
The Witch Doctor's Curse
name: River Of Fire

description:
Features Include:


The Spawn Of Death
Black Magic of Merlin
Osaki, the Murderous Jap
name: The Spawn Of Death

description:
Features Include:


The Terror of the Jap Head
The Head of Horror
In Ancient Egypt
Terror of Tokyo
Lost and Found
The Master Of Evil
The Spiked Chariot of Destruction
The March Of Murder
The Steel Monsters
name: The Terror Of The Jap Head

description:
Features Include:


Coffins For Sale
The Arabian Nights
The Land of Death
name: Coffins For Sale

description:
Features Include:


The Green Death
Tommy Tyme Visits the Colosseum
Murder In the Movies
The Monster of the Maniac Murders
name: The Green Death

description:
Features Include:


Death Solves A Puzzle
The Mad Man of Horror Mountain
The Battle of 1812
The Ghost Walks Softly
name: Death Solves A Puzzle

description:
Features Include:

The Mad Prince Shinto And His Suicide Battalion

Ambush of Death

The Flaming Avenger!

Battle of the Giants!

Ghost-Town Gunman

The Mystery of the Sacks of Death!
name: The Mad Prince Shinto And His Suicide Battalion

description:
Features Include:


Phantom of Amajo Suki
Battalion of Death
Massacre of the Mannikins
name: Phantom Of Amajo Suki

description:
Features Include:


Eeney, Meeny, Miny-Murder
The Fightin' Era
The Mummy of Death
name: Eeney, Meeny, Miny-Murder

description:
The first of three story arcs written by three of the hottest writers in crime fictions starts here! Best-selling crime novelist Gregg Hurwitz (The Kill Clause, The Crime Writer) and Laurence Campbell (PUNISHER ANNUAL: THE HUNTED) bring you a tale of death, depravity and revenge south of the border.

No one knows who they are, or what they want. Until one man travels south of the border to find outand make them pay. But to complete his mission of revenge, the Punisher will have to travel through his own personal hell, crossing a line he swore hed never cross.
name: Girls In White Dresses, Part 2: Another Day In Paradise

description: The story of this epic showdown of two universes comes to a finish. What has caused the two universes worlds to collide, and what will happen in the end. This is a must see end to an awesome event
name: Dreamwar

description: Blade is back. And what is Lady Jacqueline Falsworth to him, except another dead vampire? Plus: Excalibur in the suburbs, the tears of a Skrull and tea with Union Jack.
name: Hell comes to Birmingham - Prologue

description: Something's not right with Ben Grimm, and the mysterious malady that's afflicted him threatens to send a rampaging Thing on a destructive melee throughout Manhattan! Mr. Fantastic is working on a cure -- but there's only so much longer that the Baxter Building can contain the unbounded fury of a rock-skinned tornado!
name: The Ever-lovin', Blue-eyed End Of The World, Part 1

description:
THE INHUMANS BREAK FREE! The FF must stop Doctor Doom from wreaking havoc across the globe, and deal with the destroyed barrier that was imprisoning the Inhumans.

Continuing the arc, after Reed Richard's discussion with his alternate selfs, he begins building a "Virtual Time" device to develop the Thing's epidermal shell into a future construct. In the Thing's world, he is continuing the fight with his evil counterparts, but it doesn't look good. Reed Richards converses withy the highly evolved sentient shell of Ben Grimm,, which resembles a totem with glowing dots surrounding it. The Alternate Grimms and Ben come through into the present universe, causing Reed Richards to utilize the totem to cause the Alternate Grimms to disintegrate. The arc ends with the revelation that the Thing will not be able to shed his shell again.
name: The Ever-lovin', Blue-eyed End Of The World, Part 3

description:
The Fantastic Four race against time as they stop the evil reproductions of the Thing from wreaking havoc across the planet.

This issue saw the return of many alternate reality incarnations of The Fantastic Four, who were conversing with The Reed Richards of Earth-616 in order to find a solution to The Thing's problem, amongst the many alternates were the Marvel Mangaverse incarnations of Mr. Fantastic, The Human Torch, The Invisible Woman and The Thing.
name: The Ever-lovin', Blue-eyed End Of The World, Part 2

description:
Overview

Why exactly did Reed Richards brand his team as the Fantastic four?

Notes:

  • Ranked #87 in Wizard Magazine's list of "100 Best Single Issue Comics Since You Were Born".
name: Inside Out

concept_credits.name: 100 Best Single Issue Comics Since You Were Born

first_appearance_concepts.name: 100 Best Single Issue Comics Since You Were Born

description: Reed Richard's new data storage program comes alive and begins to stalk him.
name: Sentient Part 1

description: The story from last issue continues.
name: Sentient Part 2

description: The conclusion to the three part-story!
name: Sentient Part 3

description: Johnny's attempt to run the financial side of the Fantastic Four encounters many, many problems, including one that might destroy the entire planet.
name: Small Stuff Part 1

description:
UNTHINKABLE PROLOGUE What great sacrifice did Doom make to gain his frightful power?

This issue tells us the story about Doctor Doom's past, in Latveria, during his young years while he was in love with his former lover Valeria, a young gypsy. During a lot of flashbacks that tell us everything about their past, his initiation into black magic and his passion for technologies, in present Doctor Doom is in Latveria searching a way to contact his former lover. At the end he finally finds her in Georgia, reading fortune for money. At the end, when he finally convinces her to admit her love for him, he uses it to finish a spell that would change him forever and make him even more powerful in magics.
name: Under Her Skin

description:
UNTHINKABLE PART 1

Reed searches for the cause behind a mysterious attack on his children.
name: Unthinkable Part 1

description:
UNTHINKABLE PART 2

Doctor Doom has banished Franklin to Hell itself and his turned Valeria into his witchcraft familiar. The Fantastic Four must find a way to save both children.
name: Unthinkable Part 2

description:
UNTHINKABLE PART 3

Doom has lured the Fantastic Four out into the Latverian countryside and has engaged them in battle.
name: Unthinkable Part 3

description:
Overview:

Casey's new mentor has begun filling in the blanks concerning exactly what is happening to Casey and the answers will astound her! But considering the strange events of the last few days martial arts, murder, and super-powers nothing seems impossible anymore. And can Casey rein in her murderous impulses long enough to enjoy a class trip?
name: Chapter Five

description:
Meet the Mates! They're the greatest super team of all time, straight out of England and into our hearts: Crusader, The Solicitor, Vizier and Zipper.

But who are the heroes behind the mania? How did they meet? And what's next for The Mates? You'll find out in this fab 6-issue miniseries written by David Tischman (BITE CLUB) with art by Glenn Fabry (NEVERWHERE, PREACHER and HELLBLAZER covers) that pulls back the curtain to reveal the men behind the masks.

GREATEST HITS looks at The Mates, from their humble 1960s beginnings, through the drug-fueled 1970s, and into the techno '80s, the grungy '90s, and to the present day. This is The Mates from the height of their glory to the depths of excess, as filmed by a struggling Hollywood director - one with his own dark ties to the team.
name: Come Together

description: Meet The Phantom Limbs, an elite team of wounded soldiers saved by Cyborg's technology. The catch? The only way they can keep their new limbs is by killing for the mercenary Mr. Orr. Will Vic be able to save them from this Faustian bargain - or will they kill him first?
name: Rage Against the Machine, Part 5

description:
SEE the spectacular simian city of Monkhattan! MEET the hominoid heroes and villains - SPIDER-MONKEY! DOC OOK! IRON MANDRILL! SIMIAN TORCH! THE APE-VENGERS! And more!

THE OFFICIAL HISTORY OF THE MARVEL APE UNIVERSE

PART 2: WHEN SIMIANS CLASH AGAIN
name: See No Evil!

description:
1. "Assault on the Fortress of Solitude!" (Superman and Batman) written by Cary Burkett, penciled by Rich Buckler, inked by Joe Giella, colored by Gene D'Angelo and lettered by Ben Oda.
  2. "A Bloody Crown for a Cold Corpse!" (Green Arrow vs. Count Vertigo) written by Bob Haney, penciled by Trevor Von Eeden, inked by Brett Breeding, colored by Gene D'Angelo and lettered by Pierre Bernard Jr.
  3. "Drive Me to the Moon!" (Hawkman and Hawkgirl) written by Bob Rozakis, penciled by Alex Saviuk, inked by Rodin Rodriguez, colored by Carl Gafford and lettered by Todd Klein.
  4. "Winds of Change" (Red Tornado) written by Gerry Conway, penciled by Jose Delbo, inked by Brett Breeding, colored by Jerry Serpe and lettered by Milt Snapinn.
  5. "Chain Lightning" (Mary Marvel) written by E. Nelson Bridwell, penciled by Don Newton, inked by Steve Mitchell, colored by Adrienne Roy and lettered by John Costanza.
  6. "World's Fun-Est Puzzle"
  7. "DC Profile #78 - Don Newton" by Michael C. Carmichael.
  8. "Hembeck" by Fred Hembeck.
  9. "Daily Planet" Volume 81 Issue 9 for the month of July 1981 edited by Bob Rozakis, production by Jodi Saviuk and lettered by Typeset. Featuring the annual team up of the Justice League of America and the Justice Society of America as they battle the Secret Society of Super-Villains in Justice League of America #195. A team up of Earth-2's Huntress and Robin in Wonder Woman #284. "Len's Line-up" featuring Per Degaton versus the newly formed All-Star Squadron in All-Star Squadron #2, check out the fan created super-villains in the Dial 'H' for Hero story in Adventure Comics #486, and an all UFO issue of DC Special Blue Ribbon Digest #14. Will Wonder Girl leave the Teen Titans? Find out in The New Teen Titans #12.

Notes:

  • 48 pages no ads.
  • Rope Arrow and Knockout Gas Arrow used.
  • Hawkgirl changes her name to Hawkwoman in the Hawkman story.
  • Hyanthis cameo appearance in the Hawkman story.
name: Assault on the Fortress of Solitude! / A Bloody Crown for a Cold Corpse! / Drive Me to the Moon! / Winds of Change / Chain Lightning

description: Get ready for a Tiny Titans trip to space! Join the gang as they journey through the galaxy to help Starfire clean her room. And find out what happens at your local Bird Scouts meeting. Plus, Supergirl stops by to save the day!
name: Ya Think?;  To Get To The Other Side

description:
School is in session at Sidekick City Elementary and it's time for report cards and parent teacher conferences.

Plus, Beast Boy gets more than he bargained for with a trip to the local library and hilarity ensues at Blue Beetle's birthday party with a case of mistaken identity and much, much more!
name: Happy Feeling Blue;  Jokes On You;  Book Smarts

description: Batman (The DCU's Greatest Detective) and The Batman (Tangent's Mystical Avenger) must work together to attack the Superman's empire! Meanwhile Superman (Tangent's Hyper-evolved being) is traveling to a new world to save the people there.
name: Tangent: Superman's Reign Chapter Seven

description:
Overview:
It's all-out war between the Rannians and Thanagarians! Sardath prepares Rann's space fleet for an attack on Thanagar, but they're ill-prepared for what the Thanagarians have waiting for them. Meanwhile, Deacon Dark's plans finally come together...can the universe withstand the might of the new, all-powerful Snnyar?
name: Cursed be the Peacemakers!

description:
1. The Great Nebula (factual article : inside front cover)

2. Test Flight in Space
name: Flash Gordon

description:
1. Fighting Blades (factual article : inside front cover)

2. The Return of Zorro
name: The Return of Zorro

description:
Reed, ever the scientist, must force himself to learn and believe in magic in order to defeat Doom.

Note: This issue also came out as a special 'director's cut', with a cromium variant-cover and extra pages in the form of scripts, new scenes and an index of all 500 FF issues.
name: Unthinkable Part 4

description: The crisis with Doom is over... But the emotional scars left on the Fantastic Four are not going away anytime soon!
name: 5th Wheel Part 1

description: Franklin thinks he's still in hell. The Thing tries to help but soon realizes this is a problem Franklin must face himself.
name: 5th Wheel Part 2

description:
AUTHORITATIVE ACTION PART 1

When Doom leaves Latveria, the Fantastic Four set up shop in his castle. But what does Reed hope to achieve?
name: Authoritative Action Part 1

description:
AUTHORITATIVE ACTION PART 2

Nick Fury has been called in to deal with the Fantastic Four takeover of Latveria.
name: Authoritative Action Part 2

description:
AUTHORITATIVE ACTION PART 3

A rift forms between Reed and Ben as Mr. Fantastic's unusual behavior becomes more pronounced.
name: Authoritative Action Part 3

description:
AUTHORITATIVE ACTION PART 4

What inner demons are driving Reed Richards to the brink - and can the FF overcome them before the bombs start to rain down on Latveria?
name: Authoritative Action Part 4

description:
AUTHORITATIVE ACTION PART 5

Nick Fury and his forces invade Latveria!
name: Authoritative Action Part 5

description:
AUTHORITATIVE ACTION PART 6

Victor Von Doom has taken control of Sue Storm's mind and body. How can the rest of the team take down Doom without hurting Sue?
name: Authoritative Action Part 6

description:
HEREAFTER PART 2

Having embarked on the ultimate journey, Reed Richards and the rest of the FANTASTIC THREE must contend with the defenses of the afterlife -- and storm the gates of Heaven itself!
name: Hereafter Part 2

description:
HEREAFTER PART 3

They've faced the destroyer of everything -- Galactus. Now they face the creator of everything, as the Fantastic Four are reunited -- in the Hereafter!
name: Hereafter Part 3

description:
SPIDER-SENSE PART 1

The FF have a lot to answer for in the aftermath of AUTHORITATIVE ACTION. And when you're trying to regain the trust of cynical New Yorkers, is allying with a certain misunderstood wall-crawler a wise move?
name: Spider Sense Part 1

description: It's a sad day to be the Human Torch, when your popularity has sunk so low even the web-slinger is more beloved by the people of New York City! Plus: Who is the woman from Reed Richards' past?
name: Spider Sense

description: At an all-time low, the Fantastic Four are confronted by a cracked-mirror version of their own team.
name: Dysfunctional Part 1

description: An alternate dimension version of the Fantastic Four may scuttle any chance the FF ever has of redeeming its reputation!
name: Dysfunctional Part 2

description: The final showdown with the all-new, all-twisted Frightful Four -- and the shocking secret of their newest member could destroy both teams!
name: Dysfunctional Part 3

description: Galactus the World-Eater is coming to Earth to choose one of the Fantastic Four as his new herald -- but which one?
name: Fourtitude Part 3 of 3

description: Heavenside has seen better days. Bodies are starting to pile up, more are starting to get sick, and all the things people have always taken for granted are starting to not work. The promises of the future may all have been broken, but the Doktor has stayed true to his word-- it's getting so the only constant in people's lives is the nightly Doktor Sleepless broadcast. And although that may be just how he wants it, that's what frightens Sing the most. But with everyone listening intently to the Doktor's every word, there may be no one left to listen to what she has to say..
name: Superconnected Superinsane

description: Mr. Arkham's plans are in motion and the followers of Cthulhu are poised to strike against the heretics of Nodens. But when their epic battle spills into the Dreamlands, Mr. Arkhams plans threaten to unravel. Will anyone survive the Godwar?
name: Fall of Cthulhu: Godwar

description: Once again, Denny Colt attempts to take a vacation from the grit and violence of Central City this time at a dude ranch. But crime follows him there in the form of murder!
name: Nor Prison Walls...

description: Vext's whole pantheon is fired and they are evicted from their realm. Due to a series of mishaps he is sent to live on Earth, which is easier said than done.
name: In The Beginning

description: Vext tries to integrate into society. He attempts to purchase furniture, and to learn how to drive. Neither of these things go well.
name: Road Rage

description: Continuing to stumble through life on Earth, Vext is put on a collision course with deadly smart germs that could wipe out the whole human race.
name: Germ Warfare

description: Vext's home is invaded by a mysterious god from his past, Paramour, the patron deity of relationships gone hellishly wrong. Meanwhile, Aaron Caldwell locates the god Rypta Gud'n
name: Love Hurts!

description: Paramour reveals Vext's secret to Colleen, and she takes it pretty well all things considered. The interdimensional police force tasked with preventing such breaches in secrecy, however... not so much. Meanwhile, Aaron Caldwell successfully steals the godly powers of Rypta Gud'n. Slightly less successfully, they are terrible powers.
name: Love Stinks!

description: Everybody could be bounded in a nutshell, and count themselves a king of infinite space, were it not that they have bad dreams. Vext struggles with the nature of godhood, Colleen struggles with the price of knowledge, and Aaron struggles with ill-timed flatulence.
name: The Woman Who Knew Too Much

description:
Smile for the camera, or perish in the glare of its lens...

In the Tokyo of the future, a second Japanese economic bubble has propelled the city into a feeding frenzy of desire. The epitome of this new ethos is the Roppongi Club, an elite society serving Tokyo's most privileged citizens with fantasies beyond their wildest dreams.

Saiga is an intrepid photojournalist and war photographer intent on infiltrating the Roppongi's shadowy, secret world. But when he gets there, he discovers much more than just a glamorous hostess club. He discovers Kagura, a modern goddess whose touch transforms Saiga into the Speed Grapher, a man with the supernatural ability to make anything and anyone he photographs explode.
name: Vol. 1

description: Determined to turn goth loner Sunako into a real lady, and frustrated by their lack of progress, the guys persuade a reluctant Kyohei to take Sunako out on her first date. Now they just have to convince Sunako, who equates dating with suicide. They trick Sunako by promising her VIP seats at a pro-wrestling death match (the operative word being death). The possibility of seeing blood spilled really gets Sunako excited. Whats more, she even lets Kyohei take her out afterward to a horror flick and a delicious dinner. But wait...dinner and a movie...that almost sounds like a...Noooooooooooooooo!
name: A Date Worse than Death

description: The four hottest boys in Japan have just one goal: Turn the goth-girl Sunako into a true lady. And suddenly theyre making progress! First, Sunako ventures out on a shopping trip to one of Tokyos trendiest neighborhoods (very un-Sunako). Then she gets super-excited about Valentines Day (even more un-Sunako). Finally, when the landlady invites Sunako to a ball to meet a real prince, our gothic heroine goes on a crash diet (extremely un-Sunako). Is Sunako finally shedding her dark disposition?
name: A Lady at Last?

description:
Four of Japans hottest guys are doing their best in their mission to turn dark, macabre Sunako into a dainty young woman. Gorgeous Ranmaru is famous for his smooth way with the ladies. But when a cute toddler named Rin shows up calling Ranmaru Daddy, it seems that Ranmarus days of swinging bachelorhood may be over! Ranmaru swears that Rin is not his kid, but they sure look an awful lot alike.

Ranmaru does his darndest to avoid the little boy, but Sunako turns out to have a soft spot for the little squirt. It looks like Ranmaru just might have to accept his role as fatherand Sunako seems like the perfect mom. Will motherhood finally turn Sunako into a true lady?
name: Papa?  Mama?

description: Four gorgeous yet determined guys are still struggling to turn their reluctant, homely housemate Sunako into a proper lady. So far, the dreamy quartet have miraculously managed to cover up Sunakos total lack of progress from their landlady, Sunakos aunt, who is eager to see results. She has even set Sunako up on a blind date! If the aunt finds out that Sunako is still clinging to the darkness, their rent is sure to skyrocket. It looks like the only way out is to convince the meddling relative that Sunako already has a boyfriend. But which of the four guys could possibly pull off such a demanding role?
name: A Bachelorette with Bangs

description:
Contains the reimaged stories and prose of:

  • Arthur Jermyn (Facts Concerning the Late Arthur Jermyn and his family) - by Poe
  • The Well - by Lovecraft
  • The Window - by Lovecraft
name: Arthur Jermyn; The Well, The Window

description:
Overview

Crime does pay! In this pulse-pounding issue, CQ moves up the ranks with a power maneuver that makes Tony Sopranos machinations look like childs play. Critically acclaimed mystery novelist Gary Phillips (HIGH HAND, BANGERS) shows you the L.A. underworld you only thought you knew! Snitch on your friend. Stay out of jail.

"Public Enemy Number One" Logan has sought solace in the trappings of a rowdy river town in the Canadian wilderness, but a tragedy forces him to seek revenge in the mob-ridden windy city, Chicago. Will this crusade stop him from becoming Wolverine or does he have a greater destiny ahead of him? All these questions and more are answered in this hard-boiled tale of vengeance by the acclaimed creative team of Marvel/Epic's GUN THEORY.
name: Public Enemy Number One

description:
Overview

What if the worlds deadliest killing machine was never de-programmed? Over half a year has passed since the Hand took control of Wolverine, forcing him to assassinate one great hero after another. Now only a handful of super-powered beings are left to stop him. Who will risk their life to end the path of death and destruction? Written by the creator of indie sensation BOMB QUEEN.
name: What if Wolverine was never deprogrammed? Bite the hand that feeds

volume.name: What if? Wolverine: Enemy of the State

description: It's the final confrontation between the Frog brothers and the head vampire - but will it be too late to save Sam Emerson?

The Icons of Evil series of one-shots takes you on a roller coaster ride of action, thrills, and suspense, telling key stories in the lives of Eternia's vilest villains, and bringing their personalities and back-stories to the forefront. Featuring standalone stories, perfect for fans of the toys and the new cartoon. The young sorcerer, Keldor, ventures into the dreaded Berserker Islands of Eternia in search of the savage beasts that inhabit it. His plan is to add them to his growing army to aid in his quest to rule the world. His search puts him on a one-way collision course with the legendary Beast Man, the most savage inhabitant of the islands.
name: Beastman

volume.name: Masters of the Universe, Icons of Evil: Beastman

name: Rage of Angels, Part 5 - Goin' to Glory

description:
After their first victory against Elemental, the new men take some rest in a fun fair. They watch at a magician when a new villain, Girth, attacks him. Only the New Men can save him.
Plus, the apparition of Ikonn, the unlimited.
name: And Then Came Girth

description:
The new Men are under attack. The Armored suits of the Brotherhood of man pursue them in the sewers of Seattle, Washington. With Dash pregnant, Exit in coma and Reign refusing to use his powers, it's not a easy task to stay alive.
Fortunately, a old friend of Proctor, Khyber, helps them. but for that purpose ?
And What about the man who destroy the proof of their existence in the Proctor's house ?
And what younblood team is going to do about Reign who kill a man in the precedent issue ?
name: Newmen

description:
Flying from the Brotherhood of man, the New Men travels through the sewers of Seattle. On their side, Team Youngblood has the order to bring them to the authorities after the murder made by Reign.
But the young heroes refuse and the fight begins. And the experienced Youngblood team is far better.
Only the pregnant Dash, with the help of Pilot could escape And Proctor, allied to Khyber, joins these two in order to break free the others New Men.
New Blood goes on in Team Youngblood #15
name: New Blood Part One
Babewatch: I Kissed a Girl?!! or, Hope and Despair

volume.name: The Adventures of the New Men
The Adventures of the New Men
